Institution: Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)

Symptoms: High fever, stiffness in neck, headache, nausea/vomiting, confusion, seizures, sleepiness, sensitivity to light, lack of appetite, skin rash
Chest pain when breathing or coughing, confusion, cough (may produce sputum), fatigue, fever, low body temperature, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, shortness of breath
Throat pain, pain when swallowing, swollen tonsils, red spots on roof of the mouth, swollen lymph nodes, fever, rash, nausea/vomiting, body aches
Pain in the chest that worsens when lying down/bending over (typically after eating but also at night), bitter/acidic taste in mouth
Swelling of the tonsils, white/yellow coating/paches on tonsils, sore throat, difficult/painful swallowing, fever, bad breath,
Severe headache, chest pain, dizziness, difficulty breathing, nausea, vomiting, blurred vision, anxiety, confusion, ringing in the ears (tinnitus), nosebleed, abnormal heart beat
Feeling thirstier than usual, frequent urination, losing weight, ketones in urine, feeling of tiredness/weakness, irritable mood/mood changes, blurry vision, slow-healing sores, frequent infections

Strong urge to urinate that never ceases, burining feeling when urinating, urinating often and passing small amounts at a time, cloudy urine, red/bright pink/cola-colored urine, strong smelling urine, pelvic pain (women)
